title: Consider using semantically meaningful icons for symbols

labels.name: C-feature
labels.description: Category: New feature or request

labels.name: A-ui
labels.description: Area: UI rendering and interactions

body:
Basically this vs code issue https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/94263, but for lapce. Currently, icons are rather mysterious as to their meaning:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1711539/217882463-c9e2a699-770d-4a89-954e-410823e4ae28.png)

Using letters for icons makes them self-evident:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1711539/217882808-5f346ab6-985e-4ff8-af1b-3c7abe85b7fb.png)

title: Wrap PathBuf in RPC to be CanonPath
body:
This will ensure that any `PathBuf` that `lapce-proxy` accepts is always the canonical one.
There are still some rough edges:

1. Canonicalization might fail, so need to update/add error handling _everywhere_.
2. This might mean there are inconsistencies in `lapce-ui`, `lapce-data` and `lapce-proxy`?
i.e. the diagnostics hash map in `lapce-data` might have multiple instances of symlinks to 
the same canonical path but `lapce-proxy` doesn't?

Fixes issues like https://github.com/lapce/lapce/issues/2122 but there are many more.

Signed-off-by: Hanif Ariffin <hanif.ariffin.4326@gmail.com>

- [ ] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG.md` if this change could be valuable to users

title: Extended double-click options
body:
Extends the double-click option with the following options:
- None (single-click default)
- file (file-only double-click mode)
- all (file and folders double-click mode)

Changes:
- Field definition: `bool` -> `String`

- [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG.md` if this change could be valuable to users

title: Reflect diagnostic issues in the file explorer
body:
First implementation to fix issue here: https://github.com/lapce/lapce/issues/2108

To properly implement the feature with parent folders taking the worst severity, the painting algorithm would probably need a rewrite. It is currently painting the folders first then the files/folders inside it recursively.
So a solution might be to grab all the interested folders, precalculate how they should be drawn, THEN actually draw them.

Signed-off-by: Hanif Ariffin <hanif.ariffin.4326@gmail.com>

- [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG.md` if this change could be valuable to users

body:
Fix issue https://github.com/lapce/lapce/issues/2124

Check content history version change and EditorView change in OpenFile and OpenFileDiff.

title: Saving to a symlinked file overwrites the link

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: Category: bug - something isn't working as it's supposed to

body:
## Lapce Version

nightly-eaa1b57 (`lapce-nightly-bin` AUR package)

## System information

Arch Linux, x64

## Describe the bug

Saving a file that is a symlink to a different file overwrites the file and removes the symlink (and thus does not update the linked-to file).

Intended behaviour is to preserve/follow the link and update the original file.

## Additional information

- Created test files:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12376078/217686404-f2f07977-7cf9-4682-8563-5d5df3157804.png)

- Edited in Lapce:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12376078/217686523-d9004317-e43c-44e5-b258-0ae77fcd068b.png)

- `bar` is no longer a link:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12376078/217686673-ee08e717-3e77-4f58-a567-3f64d3c646e1.png)

title: Fix crash when switching plugin tabs too fast
body:
I have tried to debug the actual cause but I can't find it. The only place where `readme_layout` is mutated is within the `event`. So the only thing I could think of is that the `layout` phase is skipped somehow?

So simply check if the layout needs to be rebuilt. Else skip.

Signed-off-by: Hanif Ariffin <hanif.ariffin.4326@gmail.com>

- [ ] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG.md` if this change could be valuable to users

title: Open a non-existing file at command line

labels.name: C-feature
labels.description: Category: New feature or request

body:
OS: Debian 11.4

## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

When I try to create a file with lapce, I tried to execute the following commands in a terminal:

```
$ lapce newfile.sh

$ lapce -n newfile.sh
```

None of the above methods will work. This looks a bug to me, but I select a feature label in github issue to be kind.

## Describe the solution you'd like

Just make it the same behavior as all other editors such as vim, vscode etc..

title: Reflect compilation results on project tree

labels.name: C-feature
labels.description: Category: New feature or request

labels.name: A-ui
labels.description: Area: UI rendering and interactions

labels.name: A-lsp
labels.description: Area: LSP, assists and code completion

body:
A code edit can produce a lot of errors also outside current file, e.g. changing method parameters would break every method invocation.
At the moment, project tree doesn't reflect this state, e.g. writing file name in red on errors, yellow on warnings, etc...
I would be great also if folders would have the "highest raking" color, this way we can see errors also inside collapsed folders.
E.g. a folder containing a file with errors and a file with warnings should be red.
Also a folders should be recursive, e.g. a folder containing a red folder should be red itself.

title: `Plugin: Markdown` tab/page can not be shown after installation

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: Category: bug - something isn't working as it's supposed to

labels.name: A-ui
labels.description: Area: UI rendering and interactions

body:
## Lapce Version

`Lapce nightly-a93ffe0`

## System information

Debian 11.4

## Describe the bug

* Before installing `Markdown` plugin, in the Available section, clicking the plugin, the page/tab `Plugin: Markdown` shows everything in detail incluing the `Install` button.

* After installing `Markdown` plugin, in the Installed section, clicking the plugin, the page/tab `Plugin: Markdown` shows nothing (a blank page). 

* After uninstalling `Markdown` plugin, in the Available section, clicking the plugin, the page/tab `Plugin: Markdown` shows everything in detail incluing the `Install` button.

## Additional information

The above bug/issue does not happen in `Plugin: Rust` tab/page.

title: File can not be shown in Go-To-File (search file) dialog

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: Category: bug - something isn't working as it's supposed to

body:
## Lapce Version

`Lapce nightly-a93ffe0`

## System information

Debian 11.4

## Describe the bug

I open a directory which contains about 500 markdown files. One of them is `shellscript.md`.
When I press `Ctrl + p` to search file (Go to File), I type `shell` keyword in the dialog.
The filename `shellscript.md` is not shown in the result.

## Additional information

I tried to create only three files in a directory which has `shellscript.md` file.
Then open that directory in lapce.
Go to file dialog does show `shellscript.md` file when I type `shell` keyword.

title: Creating and renaming files does not work with SSH/remote on Windows GUI / Linux host

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: Category: bug - something isn't working as it's supposed to

body:
## Lapce Version

0.2.5

## System information

I run Lapce on Windows 11, editing code that lives on an Ubuntu machine.

## Describe the bug

When creating a file in a subdirectory (anywhere but the root) using the explorer (left side pane), after pressing enter to create the file, the GUI looks like nothing happened; the GUI reverts to before when I tried to create the file and the file doesn't show up. What really happens is that a file is created in the root, called `subdir\new_file.txt`, when I really wanted a file called `new_file.txt` to be created under the directory `subdir/`. The same happens when renaming files.

As far as I can tell, this makes Lapce completely broken for the use case of remote development on Linux machines from Windows; you can't really do much without the ability to create and rename files.

## Additional information

After quickly glancing at the code, it looks like the problem is in lapce-data/src/explorer.rs#L349, the line that calls `renaming.with_file_name(target_name);`. This line runs in Windows, and calls Rust path manipulation routines that make use of the system directory separator, even though the path is in fact not a path for the system that the code runs on.

Given that Rust `Path` objects make the assumption that the directory separator is the one of the current system, it seems potentially conceptually wrong to use `Path` objects in this layer of the code. But it might also be fine. What does seem categorically wrong is the use of `with_file_name` in this part of the code. The first fix that comes to mind would be to change the format of `LapceUICommand::RenamePath` such that `with_file_name` would be called on the other end of the RPC (i.e. in `dispatch.rs`), so that the right directory separator is used.

title: Font Family configuration discrepancy

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: Category: bug - something isn't working as it's supposed to

body:
## Lapce Version
0.2.5

## System information
Windows 10

## Describe the bug
When defining the UI Font Family, if the font name has spaces, then it is required to wrap the font family name in quotes otherwise it doesn't seem to work.  But when setting the Editor Font Family, if you wrap the same font family name that contains spaces in quotes, then it doesn't work here.  Perhaps the settings are handled/parsed differently.

body:
## Lapce Version
0.2.5

## System information
Windows 10

## Describe the bug
Font variations don't seem to be supported.  For example, I had "Cascadia Code" listed in my UI Font Family setting but the font seems very thin and strains the eyes.  I tried updating to "Cascadia Code SemiBold" (and others) but it doesn't seem to change the font rendering at all.

title: Add theme parameters for operators and function calls

labels.name: C-feature
labels.description: Category: New feature or request

labels.name: A-syntax
labels.description: Area: syntax highlighting

body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Several code editor themes require the ability to change the color of the operators (`+`, `-`, `=`, `!`, etc.), as well as a different color for function calls than for function declarations,

## Describe the solution you'd like

I'd like two new theme parameters to be added: `operator`, and `functionCall`,

## Describe alternatives you've considered

There are no alternatives I can think of.

## Additional context

Trying to port [Monokai Vibrant](https://github.com/dylantmarsh/monokai-vibrant) to Lapce
